prompt: Dream_Text: I'm planting potatoes. It seems to be nighttime. I feel lightheaded so I sit down then lay down on the ground. There are other people around. Or something like that. The man releases his grip immediately but it doesn't seem fast enough. I am still planting potatoes but now it is day time and I'm just with my mom. I am in the process of planting the potatoes at the ends of a row of garden beds. It occurs to me that I hadn't asked my mom if this is okay and they are her garden beds. I ask her and she says it's fine and I can plant them wherever there is room. She asks me how many pounds of potatoes I had grown last year. I said I didn't know because I hadn't weighed them because I remembered I hadn't harvested them all at once but little by little as I thought they were ready. In the dream this seems to be the third year in a row I have planted potatoes." ;  Background_Info: __ ;  Wakeup_State: __ ###
completion: I think you've been doing something for a long time, probably longer than 3 years, that is helping you and others plant for harvest. Sometimes you need help, but oftentimes you just need company and rest. Most people are well-meaning, but if they're unhelpful, if you teach them how they can be more helpful, they'll be more helpful once they get it. Also, sometimes it seems to be nighttime, when it's just that you're weary and not with the right company and rest. When you get the right company and rest, it feels more like daytime, because we have more energy, whether it is or isn't literally. I'd say make sure your mom knows you appreciate her too. A saying comes to mind, "Don't grow weary in doing well, because in due time, you will reap a harvest." Never underestimate planting, no matter how long that season lasts. Keep doing as well as you know in every worthwhile endeavor, and it is actually impossible for that not to pay off. In due time is frustrating, but the patience you learn and later the timing of the reward will be impeccable. [END]

prompt: Dream_Text: I was smoking a cigarette, walking by a busy and narrow street. This place looks like a favela, although much cleaner and the ambiance was happy and full of energy. I was about to cross the street when I noticed the people started running out of this man‚Äôs way. This guy was riding a scooter. He was wearing a denim cap, green long sleeve shirt, light wash pants and a pair of slippers. On his back was a sheath with a long and heavy machete with blood on it. He also had a gun but I can‚Äôt recall if it was a shotgun or a rifle. I felt something very evil and sinister as he went past me. Then I went to this share house, upstairs where I was supposed to be living: talked to my housemates and did some other things I couldn‚Äôt recall, but I‚Äôm pretty sure those parts were fun that I forgot about the guy in the green shirt. I climbed the staircase and opened the door at the end and there I was on the rooftop smoking another cigarette. This share house was relatively taller than most buildings that I could watch the neighbors through their windows, the street market and the people walking around. It felt very calm. Then this woman busted out of the door - also wearing a green shirt - shaking and crying, begging for help. This woman was bleeding all over and I could see one of her eyes sticking out of her face with a huge open wound on her temple showing her cracked skull. I asked her what happened and she said ‚Äúhe‚Äôs here‚Äù. Then I remembered the man with a green shirt. Then the mood of that dream turned into something out of a horror movie. The sky turned blood red. The people around were shouting ‚Äúwatch out! Lock your doors!‚Äù, warning the others including me. The commotion kept getting closer and closer; the kind of noise you would hear from people screaming in terror. Then I heard loud thuds inside the share house and the footsteps on the staircase. I realized that he was after the woman. I shouted at the neighbors to call the cops. I locked the door on the rooftop from the outside with just a slide lock using a concrete nail as the barrel bolt. That way it could buy us some time at least. I grabbed her and we jumped and ran on the roof of other houses and shacks. ;  Background_Info: __ ;  Wakeup_State: __ ###
completion: This is a dream about your shadow and the Anima plain and simple. The shadow is the part of the psyche that compensates for one-sidedness in the ego. For example if you become too self righteous in some area your shadow becomes darker in compensation. In dreams it shows up for a man as a male ‚Äòother‚Äô or a dark and sinister place. In the case of this dream it is both. The Woman is the Anima. The anima is the relating factor of the psyche and it helps us relate to both our inner world and outer world. It shows up in a man‚Äôs dreams or fantasies as a woman or animal. It is usually projected onto a woman since one of its roles is to help in relating to a mate for the continuation of the species which is a vital role. It is usually misinterpreted as an inner woman. It‚Äôs not. It‚Äôs an aspect of the male psyche that gets projected onto a woman. Now, the interesting part. When we go inward to our collective Unconscious, the first thing we usually encounter is our shadow. Like I said, when the ego becomes too one sided, the shadow activates as a compensatory mechanism to bring the psyche back into homeostasis. While this self regulation is happening, we lose the connection with our relating factor, the Anima (for a woman Animus). When we lose touch with our Anima, when it is clouded over by the shadow, we lose touch with our deeper instinctive self and it‚Äôs impulses. This manifests an internal psychological pressure which may come in the form of anxiety or anger. It‚Äôs kind of an instinct ‚Äòwounding‚Äô. Another interesting thought is the wound on the eye of the Anima. It‚Äôs the dreams way of showing you that while the shadow is active, it is not able to perform its task of looking inward or outward to full capacity. [END]

prompt: Dream_Text: I was walking through medieval cellars that were continually getting tighter, in one instance I even had to squeeze through. on the floors, there laid a number of turtles, some on their back, some about to fall, and some just lying normally. Their heads were scaly, some reminiscent of a dragon. When I got out of the cellar I found myself on a town square. It was evening, lights dim with some shadows flying around. Only one shadow was dense and round. It wore a blue and white jacket with a masquerade mask. I provocatively yelled at it "Hey death!" It noticed me and started slowly and ominously chasing me. Suddenly, a girl clad in a celebratory village dress. She said that "It¬¥s starting" and took me inside of a room that was connected with the town square. A great iron gate with bars was closed behind me. More girls who had the same dress were inside. Clergymen started a prayer, yet I did not know the words. I felt ashamed, anxious, and the shadow was staring at me hauntingly. Then a dance started, I did not know the moves, I was being pushed around, I even pushed off a glass that broke. Everyone was dancing on the glass shards and clothes that looked like mine that weren't there before. The Clergymen were watching me disapprovingly. The women did not care, they were happy that I was trying to dance with them. After the dance, I started picking up the shards and cut myself accidentally. My blood was not dense, and it was watery. After the cut, my father called me and asked me how I was. ;  Background_Info: __ ;  Wakeup_State: I woke up cold and anxious ###
completion: This is one of those dreams that sound amazing for Jungian interpretation - so full of symbols. There is a very classic interpretation by Jung (one of his own dreams if I remember correctly) where he interpreted a house in a dream as an image if the mind. The basement is the subconscious. Deep beneath the house is the collective unconscious, where dragons and monsters dwell. These are the complexes of the collective unconscious, the things that you need to face in order to mature as a human being. Tod Venn mentions the dragons and Shadow above. The village and traditional clothing also sounds as relating to the collective subconscious. I think Peterson would say that this relates to drives that are collective to us as humans, and sometimes older that Homo Sapiens. There is a conflict here between the feminine (the women) and a religious and/or patriarchal authority (clergy, your father). There appears to be a situation that is out of your control; the dancing on broken glass, closed gates, you are pushed around and don't know the moves. Maybe some kind of ecstatic feeling of being out of control. Maybe you need to learn to let go? There is also a conflict here; on the one hand you are trying to dance, on the other hand the clergy and your father are disapproving of you. You may want to contemplate this in relation to your relationship to your father. This may either refer to your actual father or be a symbol of a hierarchical way of thinking, especially as relating to religion and spirituality (considering the clergy). The part about the blood is also interesting, and I would advise you to contemplate it rather that try to give you an answer. My spontaneous associations are that blood is thicker than water, and also the passage in the Gospels where a Roman sticks a spear into the side of the crucified Christ, and both blood and water comes out (a scene which is closely related to baptism and the Mass), but these are my associations, not yours. [END]

I wonder whether this is about the way you judge against the naturally repressed aspects of your own personality which have value, which the unconscious projects onto the masculine symbol here. Given the thug, this dream may relate to the initial stage of Animus integration, and given that you were involved in the killing of him, may speak to how you judge against and repress what he represented, in yourself. The killing may also imply a transition from the first stage, to the second stage of the development of your Animus. In the second stage the Animus, the symbolically masculine aspect of the female's personality is associated with forward planning, among other things, as you were in this dream. [END]

prompt: Dream_Text: A certain tree and a certain fungus. completion: Many fungi, especially those associated with forest growth, are symbiotic. The "fly agaric," or amanita muscaria, for example, which is almost never found outside pine forests. Through underground mycelial networks, "mother" trees are able to support their offspring with nutrients and water, and the fungus obtains nutritional resources from the trees in exchange for this help. Images of trees, of course, are rich with meaning. They are some of our most sacred symbols - Yggdrasil, the Cross, the Axis Mundi, etc. Perhaps the fungus in this dream is some sort of translator.  [END]

prompt: Dream_Text: Last night I dreamt that he was back, I was a kid again, and all my family was together looking for a house and trying to start ‚Äúa new life‚Äù, everything was the way it was before he died. All my family, brother, mom, dad, grandpa and grandpa, aunts etc was sitting around a table, eating dinner. Then I ‚Äúwoke up‚Äù, and I was all alone by the table. So I woke up from a dream, in my dream. And I started crying and looking for my family, and I said over and over ‚Äúit‚Äôs too much, I can‚Äôt take this anymore‚Äù. ;  Background_Info:  I have had so many sad dreams for about a year. Crying and screaming in my sleep, + it freaks my bf out. My dad committed suicide 12 years ago, I was 11 at the time. I had a tough time dealing with it for many years, but I‚Äôve been working on letting go and move on for about 3 years. The dreams are very different, but it‚Äôs always the same pattern: my dad comes back for a day, week, month, and he totally ignores me. I try to talk to him but he just pushed me away and talk to everyone else. Then when it‚Äôs time for him to go back to ‚Äúheaven‚Äù (I‚Äôm not a religious person), he tells me he loves me and misses me, and that I have to move on. And then I scream and cry and wake up crying. ;  Wakeup_State:  and then I woke up crying. It feels like the more I‚Äôm working on moving on from my past, my dreams about family and dad gets worse. I don‚Äôt know what to do or what it means. Have anyone experienced something like this or know what it means? ###
completion: I think you are dreaming of your dad more and more because while the feeling of loss was raw and unprocessed, all you felt was the grief of his loss, and the palpable absence of this person. You felt "he is gone! He is not here!" And the pain of that was first and foremost. Now that you are processing the grief, you are moving back to the feeling of his presence, and the joy and comfort that you felt being together with him, the love he had for you. You always had the joy, love and comfort there too, underneath the pain of loss, but couldn't access it. Now you can open and access this joy again, because the grief is not making you turn away from the happiness that is there. Of course this is a scary process - opening to feeling comfort, joy, love, security, happiness, this is a reminder of how that good feeling is something that can be taken away. Which is frightening. And causes inner conflict "maybe I shouldn't feel the joy, because then it will hurt more if I lose that feeling". The dream is telling you, "you never lost that feeling, it has always been there and it always will be there. The joy is bigger than the grief. The pain turned you away from the joy, the joy never left" It is saying that your father, in this way, and also in how you are very much like him in many good ways, your father has never left you. Instead of feeling his absence, you are feeling his presence, as you open up to the positive attachment you felt with him, and as you open up to the side of yourself that is very much like your father. In the dreams, the contrast of being alone and being with family is a reminder that you are never truly alone when you have loved and been loved. For all those you connect with in life, you live in their hearts, as they live in yours. In this way, there is a life beyond death, time, and place. [END]

prompt: Dream_Text: I'm driving a car in a world I am familiar with, it's a video game world, more specifically the Grand Theft Auto world. (I‚Äôve never really played the game by the way, IF I played it, my time was spent driving around legally, not even speeding. So it‚Äôs safe to say I haven‚Äôt really played it) I realize the cops are chasing me, no small amount of cops, cars and policemen on foot. I'm an evil man (woman in real life btw which is interesting as well), a criminal. I drive fast and recklessly and I‚Äôm running through several doors, up and down stairs‚Ä¶.Soon I've gotten rid of the cops, they're not after me anymore. I'm in an empty house that‚Äôs still being built, it‚Äôs basically still just an iron structure (similar to the one in The Dark Knight when Batman and Joker battle)‚Ä¶I'm not alone, Aragorn (Lord of the Rings) is there fighting me and he has a sword, I also have a sword. We are hanging on iron pillars and fencing. I get a hold of his sword and I kick him off the building, I watch him fall while I hang there. When he hits the ground I look up at the building, there I see millions of faces / heads on the building - like manikin heads. I instantly know it‚Äôs me, my face, but instead of it being my own real life face, I'm the Joker (Joker 2020 version) with a disgusting grin on its face. ;  Background_Info: Most times when I have a nightmare I am running away from evil, or in some other way trying to escape evil. This time I was evil running away from heroes. I loved the Joker 2020 movie. ;  Wakeup_State: I wake up and I do not want to fall asleep again, I escaped, I won, but I'm evil. ###
completion:
You are not the villain! However your dream is simply giving you a view of what might be going on within you at this time. You say it‚Äôs a nightmare for you and right from the start we understand that your dream is giving you a glimpse into what you normally wouldn‚Äôt perceive since the suggestion is this part of your life is in darkness but what is now revealed by your dream at first seems frightening simply because you previously could not see/perceive it. Before we start it would be helpful to understand from my perspective that we all experience inner conflict.  Look at this, another law, another way, waging war against you waging war against your mind with the purpose of taking you captive. This happens to us all through temptation to various things which we should know better. Looking at your dream again we see your villain is running away from the heroes, he‚Äôs been caught out now whereas before he/she was lurking in the unseen darkness gently deceiving you at first but now your dream has exposed the villain within and he‚Äôs on the run, he wants to hide from all this light you are subjecting him to, but he can‚Äôt because you‚Äôve reached a point where you are determined to chase down this villain. So on one hand your villain is become exposed on the other hand you are not comfortable at realizing there is actually a villain lurking within whose purpose is to bring you into captivity and steal your vehicle. Now you realize that you must actively engage to take this villain into your captivity, reign him in!  The car here is probably your outward every Day body/vehicle and you are a driven type of person seems obvious. You have the drive to go forward in your immediate world whatever that is eg business/ sports whatever? You are driven! In your dream your world identifies with grand theft auto? From memory elite vehicles have been shopped and stolen for a specific customer who really likes and want that style of vehicle, they are willing to pay for it. Here‚Äôs the thing, it does seem like you are an elite person of sorts your vehicle holds a special place of interest designed to move fast in the company of elite vehicles similar to yourself. You have perfected the design and you are now sought after by others within your familiar life. But now we see the villain entering in to steal away your vehicle just like in grand theft auto where the owner has perfected his ability to design his life the way he wants and make his vehicle streamlined to suit his own particular purpose only to find to his dismay the villain the thief who has done no such work but simply comes along to steal your car, your streamlined vehicle that was designed by you to suit a specific purpose. So now we can see you as the hero and the villain, the hero as one who puts in all the design work and produces a streamlined vehicle and you also as the villain want into to steal the car away simply to sell it to the highest bidder (grand theft auto) You are perhaps young and don‚Äôt understand this concept, your streamlined vehicle was made that way by vigilant had work according to the law of your mind. The villain is the thief who see‚Äôs the beautiful vehicle and has done nothing to make it great and elite and simply steals it from you. So far your dream is showing you to take good care of the vehicle you have produced because the thief is always looking to steal it from you. You are not the thief as you so describe yourself ‚Äú you do not normally speed etc because you are a careful and thoughtful and you don‚Äôt break the law you are not not reckless with your vehicle, each of us need to at some time need to contend. with this situation because we are so given to conditioning ourselves we don‚Äôt notice other thoughts creeping in, and this I bother thief creeps into your life, while you are busy conditioning yourself you don‚Äôt notice him gradually sneaking in. By stealing your vehicle (GTA) he will only destroy what you have created. Here we see your villain warring against your good mind trying to derail you and eventually sell your vehicle for gain rather than use it for what you originally designed it for.
Your villain now realises the cops (your conscience) are chasing him up, that‚Äôs why he‚Äôs running, he‚Äôs a thief and he‚Äôs stealing your vehicle and as all good cars have an anti theft device so too does your conscience alert you to the attempted theft of your streamlined vehicle.you understand a criminal act is in progress you are alerted by your cops, police etc friends groups etc something is not right something criminal is taking place?
You are not a criminal you are not reckless but now the criminal within you must remember does not live by the same laws as you live by, remember he is lurking in the darkness and warring against your good mind and he‚Äôs waiting for an opportunity to steal your good work.
Your villain is criminally minded that is he breaks all the good laws that you abide by. He manages to elude you through doors and up and down stairs.. perhaps the doors he runs to escape are doors you unwitting opened and now he is using them to escape from you.the stairs you climbed the highs and the lows you‚Äôve battled through he is now using them to his advantage. [END]

prompt: Dream_Text: I am in an underground activity, like an escape room but on a larger scale, like a labyrinth. There are lots of people walking around trying to find the way out, but getting nowhere. One of them is an old dancing partner when I was taking ballroom dancing lessons. I get the impression of a long time searching for the proper path. The focus of the dream is when I come to an old temple, Ancient Greek-ish with a large granite statue, specifically granite with a rustic pinkish hue. Looking up into the temple roof I realise no one is up there and it dawns on me that the path is likely up there as no one down here has found the way, so I head up there. The dream then goes to an out of body view of the path. There is an above ground bridge like structure, and the way corkscrews as a tunnel around it. Because its a tunnel everyone assumes its underground, but it isn't, its not logical. That's the trick. ;  Background_Info: __ ;  Wakeup_State: __ ###
completion: The subconscious here in the subterranean can mean both the shadow or unexplored self, which turns into impulse if we are not aware of it, and also the subsistence level mindset or even a survivalist mindset, where we react to life instead of choosing things in life. This happens if we have a bunch of unresolved issues or trauma that bogs us down, and we find ourselves defensive or triggered often by daily occurances, we cannot respond to these with openness or full responsiveness, because we have shut ourselves down due to the fight, flight or freeze reaction. (I more and more think that the key to unconscious/ consciousness exploration is linked with the parasympathetic nervous system response. And that neuroscience is finding out what religion has said for a long time - that love is consciousness, the higher path, awareness.... it is only when we feel the safety of being loved that we can actually open our awareness with our higher faculties). And so many are stuck in this trap. Or puzzle or maze like an escape room. It is like a trap, because interestingly, we cannot truly figure out this unconscious reactivity this defensive triggered survival mode while we are actually in it. Neuroscience is saying this too. That you feel safe again first. THEN look at understanding the trigger. But first, get out of the hole you are in, to see from a wider perspective. Often, we get trapped in the survivalist mode because we try to figure it out from within that survivalist mode. For example, someone who feels triggered by another‚Äôs behavior might then identify that behavior as the cause of the trigger. But this doesn't actually go very far in understanding, overcoming, or resolution. It merely cements the knowledge that the world is unsafe and that we have to have our defenses up instead of trying to find common ground. The tunnels I think are a metaphor similar to the "trances" they often talk about in the new age (and sometimes psychology). The auto pilot mode, that is living unconsciously, without conscious awareness and choice making. "Tunnel vision" is seeing only the narrowest path in front of you and no way out. This can be like depression "a long dark tunnel". Tunneling into something also in a more positive way can be about obsessive focus on figuring out the originating path of some particular behavioral pattern. Sometimes I think we do have to delve deeply into an obsessive thought on a specific topic in order to understand that pattern in our life. But, as in your dream, the idea is to recall you are not just in a negative obsessive circular thought pattern. But that instead you are "tunneling" up and out, in order to find the secret way to unlock this particular unconscious behavioral pattern, to crack the code, to be able to stop unconsciously repeating it. [END]

prompt: Dream_Text: In my dream, I am in the attic of a palatial building that is public, but somehow also mine. A small staircase leads upwards. To the left is the interior of a baroque church. completion: It does seem obvious that for you to have this type of dream or story that you would be heavily connected, in some way? Some observations‚Ä¶ 3 water scoops, 3 coffins and 3 people you, your fianc√© and his infant brother? The description of the water scoops is telling. First of all water in relation to a church belong to Christ. The building is made of people understand fully that water represents cleansing and washing. holy and without blemish. Notice the church is subject to Christ! Notice the water is the word of god that is used for washing our lives. The purpose of washing is that the church will be presented to Christ as holy and beautiful and virtuous. In your dream we notice the first scoop of water is in ‚Äúpolished wood‚Äù? This is meant to be for the washing of the church as God‚Äôs word is meditated upon and read daily his spirit makes it clean our conscience making us one with him. The wood represents the natural man who, in the church of Christ will go down into the waters of baptism and the natural man will die but ride again in Christ In the baroque style pagan church this is called holy water is Only for show, this is evident as ‚Äúpolished wood‚Äù is the description. Yes the church is highly polished to attract followers but the true meaning is lost in the polish. Religion is highly polished. The silver scoops in the bible speak of redemption and purification. The process of heating silver to burn off the dross and other imperfections is a metaphor used throughout Scripture. God‚Äôs Word itself is described in value beyond silver: ‚ÄúThe promises of the LORD are pure, like silver refined in a furnace and purified seven times‚Äù (Ps 12:6). The purification process was sometimes used as a symbol for the way God tests and refines people: ‚ÄúYou have tested us, O God. You have refined us in the same way silver is refined‚Äù (Ps 66:10; see also Isa 48:10). A silversmith would have to attentively watch the silver, getting it to just the right heat, in order to purify the metal. God also watches us as he put us through fiery trials, never leaving us for an instant and only allowing the situation to progress to the point where it is helpful for our sanctification. In the church of Venus the water and silver scoops are just for show however Venus may expect her followers to perform rituals suitable for her? What‚Äôs missing here is the gold of course which represents the golden nature of Jesus. Peter the disciple and apostle makes mention of silver and gold showing the true meaning of being washed in water and refined by fire. [END]

prompt: Dream_Text: I dream that I‚Äôm back in my childhood bedroom. He continues to standing facing away from me as I hit him. ;  Background_Info:  I have a reoccurring dream about the man who used to molest me as a teenager and I need help to understand what it means, I feel like there has to be a reason I keep having it. ;  Wakeup_State: I wake up having cried in reality during my sleep. ###
completion: My thoughts are that the dream is calling you to do some further work. Being in the room you shared tells me that the dream is about the mindset you occupy around this issue. There are always many threads to the symbols and lots of different ways to approach them. My interpretation is just one suggestion. It seems the room has been cleared in preparation of remodelling and renovation. Your psyche needs an update in some way. Yet you used the word "barren" so it may also be that this space internally has become a barren and empty place for you. I wonder if you have tried to clear away the issue in some way, or you just want to paint it over and cover up what happened. Maybe that's something you tried to do when you were young. Baby blue suggests an innocence. A color we might paint for a new baby's room. Blue is the color of the throat chakra, the center of our communication, it invites us to talk and express ourselves, especially verbally. It's also a color of peace and tranquility. I feel that the painting is a way of saying i want to start again. I want to prepare for a new beginning, to clear away the old and welcome in the new. The color is "light" and insights those themes too. But the man seems to have too much power because he is always able to undo your efforts. Red is a very emotive color bringing them of lust, passion, danger and anger. I feel the scene is describing what occupies your mental space over the issue. It seems he is still able to take over and "color‚Äù" things. I‚Äôm sure this experience in many ways has "colored" or informed the rest of your life, perhaps with a darkness. Your asking him to stop is very positive because you recognize the unwanted and ongoing influence in your life. But your pleas and physical attempts to make it stop are not working. And I feel this probably the crux of it. It's very very sad and unfair, this man violated you when you were a powerless. He broke the law, the trust of your family and broke every sacred boundary that is held by good decent loving people. The softball racket I feel represents your efforts as a child who nearly did not have the power to make it stop by her own efforts. That was not your fault and I feel the dream is repeating because it wants to call you forward as the adult you now are. It's replaying this internal video because its still playing out in various ways within you. You need to address the issue to get the dream to change and hopefully stop. The painting shows that you want to start over. Painting your own childhood room and the location of your pain, suggests you want to welcome the child who you were. She still lives within you, painting her room in a new and fresh way invites healing and safety and a way to refresh yourself for a new start. [END]

prompt: Dream_Text: I was walking through medieval cellars that were continually getting tighter, in one instance I even had to squeeze through. on the floors, there laid a number of turtles, some on their back, some about to fall, and some just lying normally. Their heads were scaly, some reminiscent of a dragon. When I got out of the cellar I found myself on a town square. It was evening, lights dim with some shadows flying around. Only one shadow was dense and round. It wore a blue and white jacket with a masquerade mask. I provocatively yelled at it "Hey death!" It noticed me and started slowly and ominously chasing me. Suddenly, a girl clad in a celebratory village dress. She said that "It¬¥s starting" and took me inside of a room that was connected with the town square. A great iron gate with bars was closed behind me. More girls who had the same dress were inside. Clergymen started a prayer, yet I did not know the words. I felt ashamed, anxious, and the shadow was staring at me hauntingly. Then a dance started, I did not know the moves, I was being pushed around, I even pushed off a glass that broke. Everyone was dancing on the glass shards and clothes that looked like mine that weren't there before. The Clergymen were watching me disapprovingly. The women did not care, they were happy that I was trying to dance with them. After the dance, I started picking up the shards and cut myself accidentally. My blood was not dense, and it was watery. After the cut, my father called me and asked me how I was. ;  Background_Info: __ ;  Wakeup_State: I woke up cold and anxious ###
completion: The dark, ominous "shadow" chasing you was your Shadow, in the Jungian sense - all the things which you reject and repress in yourself. Jung would say the turtle is a common symbol of the Self, a turtle on it's back or about to fall might represent a less than ideal state of the Self, one in need of/lacking help. He has also described the turtle as representing the transcendent function, that which unites the opposites. Jung has also said reptile-like scales - and the dragon - are associated with the sympathetic nervous system. Incidentally, the sympathetic nervous system is what constricts blood vessels, allowing them to move through smaller spaces under pressure, as you were in this dream. I wonder whether your blood taking on a watery quality is somehow also related. You said you woke up cold. vasoconstriction of the blood vessels is what keeps you warm when cold. Ordinarily, blood is associated with emotion, in Jungian interpretations. To me, this dream seems like it might be about integration of the personal Shadow, in order to aid the development of the Self, but given your point about watery blood, crawling along constricted routes, and waking up cold, I wonder whether this dream is simply a response to your physical state at the time of the dream. [END]
